question.text: Which statement is not true for the base ratio of DNA?

options.text: Base ratio is constant for a given species.
Base ratio is variable for different species.
Base ratio does not depend on age of organism
Base ratio is different for different tissues of organism.

solution.text: According to Chargaff' rule ratio of  <math><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">G</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></mrow></mrow></math>  is called base ratio and it is specific for a given species but variable for different species. For prokaryotic species it if less than 1 and for eukaryotic species it is greater than 1.
